course_title: Special Topics in Biology: The Biology of Aging
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 30 / Seats Avail: 30Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
(Full Title:  Integrative Biology of Aging:  Why We Age and Why We Don't Have To.)  
This course will discuss the effects of the aging process on the physiology of organisms and the impact on systems involved in maintaining physical and cognitive function.  We will discuss changes to organ systems that are known to become dysregulated with age, as well as some of the biotechnology, bioengineering, bioinformatics, and regenerative medicine approaches to combat aging and age-related diseases.  Prerequisites:  Biology 142 + 142L and Biology 336.
course_description: A course on topics of special biological interest, designed for Biology majors elective credit. This course is repeatable when the topic varies.
prerequisites: (BIOL 142 and BIOL 142L) or BIOL_OX 142WE or equivalent transfer credit as a prerequisite.
